fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the user inserts content in the header and/or footer of the space, it will be reflected on all the pages, except the "Overview" one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a space administrator, go to a space
# Tap the *Settings* button on the sidebar
# Select the *Look and Feel* tab and tap *Header and footer*
# Insert any text on the Header and footer fields
# Tap the *Save* button

h3. Expected Results
The header and footer should be applied to all the space.

h3. Actual Results
The header and footer are applied to all the pages, except the overview one.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The header and footer applied to the space is not included in the Overview page
Display options changes are not being saved in the Jira Issue macro (new editor)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error is generated when creating an application from a server application into Confluence cloud. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira server
 # Create an application link to https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/wiki


h3. Expected Results

The link should be establish between the server application and Confluence cloud. 

h3. Actual Results

An error is returned. 

{code}
Unable to auto-configure a Consumer as the remote Consumer-Info could not be found.
{code}

 !conflcoud.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot establish new application links from server to Confluence cloud

fields.description:
Dear Development Team,

We use the functionality of Confluence on a large scale and have convinced so many customers of the power of this tool. With the old / old editor, we have developed templates that can be used to prepare large (SAFe) PI plannings in an optimal manner. In our templates, we {color:#de350b}nested the EXTENDED MACRO and put it into individual fields of tables{color}.

To drop a given functionality does not make a product any better. On the contrary, it disappoints the user when it suddenly stops working as usual.
fields.summary: Macro in Macro => EXTENDED Macro within Extended Macros and within table cells

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When printing a page (CMD + P) in Google Chrome, Mac OS Catalina, the characters on the page are not rendered.

h3. Environment
* Mac OS Catalina
* Google Chrome
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a confluence page
# Using Mac OS Catalina, access the page and print the page (cmd + p)

h3. Expected Results
Page is rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
The page is not rendered as to how the page looks.

h3. Example:
 [^[BUS-1] Tes - Jira - Old issue View.pdf] - This is on JIRA but you'll get the idea on how will it looks like in Confluence

h3. Notes
Customers use the feature instead of the export to PDF feature as they would like to capture the comments on the page as well.

Seems to be affecting JIRA on the old view as well.

h3. Workaround
Use other browser - Safari
fields.summary: Exported/printed page is not rendered properly when using the browser's print feature in Google Chrome Mac OS Catalina

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Confluence in a non-English language, the invite people dialog is not localized - it's in English
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set your language to Japanese (User menu -> Settings), and make sure you are a trusted user (with invite user permissions)
 # Hit the 'invite people' button in the global navigation
 # Notice the content is in English

h3. Expected Results

The content is in Japanese
h3. Actual Results

It's in English
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using Confluence in a non-English language, the invite people dialog is not localized

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Confluence in a non-English language, the Share component remains in English: the button as well as its popup dialog.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set your language to Japanese (User menu -> Settings)
 # Visit a page
 # Notice the blue Share button at the top, and its dialog, is in english

h3. Expected Results

The share component is localized to Japanese
h3. Actual Results

It's all in English
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using Confluence in a non-English language, the Share component is not localized

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The page like message is made up of many string concatenations, which is not localizable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set your language to Japanese
 # Like a page, with no other existing likes
 # Observe the message

h3. Expected Results

The message should read "いいね! しています"
h3. Actual Results

The message says "あなた like this". (Just "you" has been directly translated.)
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The page like message is not internationalized correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a space with non-latin characters, the space key doesn't auto fill and the user has to manually enter a space key.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence instance, hit Spaces -> Create new space
 # Enter テスト as the space name

h3. Expected Results

The space key auto-populates as it does when entering English characters
h3. Actual Results

The space key remains blank.
h3. Workaround

Manually enter some characters as the space key.
fields.summary: When using a non-latin space name, the space key doesn't auto fill

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Despite being able to create completely Japanese/non-latin spaces in the normal space creation experience, you cannot progress the welcome experience without some latin characters in the space name. This is not a suitable experience for Japanese/Chinese/Korean and other non-latin script countries.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence instance
 # Enter テスト as the space key when prompted
 # Try to progress to the next step of the welcome experience

h3. Expected Results

You can create the space and continue the welcome experience
h3. Actual Results

You receive an error message saying space names must have non-latin characters to proceed
h3. Workaround


You can rename the space after it's been created by visiting the Space settings page.
fields.summary: Using a Japanese space name in the welcome experience is not allowed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a non-English user joining Confluence, and creating a demo space, its content is always in English. It should be localized.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit atlassian.co.jp
 # Create a trial Confluence instance
 # Go through the (unfortunately English) welcome experience
 # View the automatically created demo space

h3. Expected Results

The content of the demo space is in Japanese
h3. Actual Results

It's in English
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When signing up to Confluence as a non-English user, the demo space content is not localized

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When signing up to Confluence as a Non-English user, the welcome experience appears in English. This also happens when "trying" Confluence from the Switcher in as a non-English user in a Jira instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit atlassian.co.jp 
 # Create a Confluence trial instance
 # Wait for the site to spin up and begin the "Welcome to Confluence" experience

h3. Expected Results

The welcome experience is in Japanese
h3. Actual Results

It's in English
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Confluence welcome experience is in English when signing up in non-English language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a group is created in a mixed case like THIS_Group and later this group name is used in the page restrictions, page restrictions show the group name inconsistently. Like this_group, THIS_Group. Page restrictions work fine but *Content by label* macro doesn't work properly. When the macro is run by the user which otherwise can access a restricted page directly, the macro doesn't return the restricted page which has that label. Creating and using a group in all lower case fixes this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some test pages and add a label e.g. test_label to each page.
# Create a group in the mixed case. e.g. THIS_Group
# Add some members.
# Use this group in the page restrictions. (edit/view restrictions)
# Check that page is accessible to the users allowed in the page restrictions.
# # Add *Content by label* macro on a page. Configure the macro to search for a label that you added on those pages above.
# Check the results.

h3. Expected Results
The *Content by label* macro should return all the pages having the label which the user has access to.

h3. Actual Results
The *Content by label* macro doesn't return the pages which are restricted to the group having the mixed-case name.

h3. Workaround

* Create a new group with all lower-case letters and use this group in the page restrictions.
fields.summary: Group name in mixed case causes macro to work incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, if the user the [Excerpt Include macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html] with links from a [Table of Contents macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/table-of-contents-macro-724765294.html], the links will point to the current page, instead of the original one containing the links in the [Excerpt macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-macro-724765191.html].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On page A, insert the [Excerpt macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-macro-724765191.html] and a [Table of Contents macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/table-of-contents-macro-724765294.html].
# Outside of the Excerpt macro, make sure to have headers created on page A to generate the table of contents links.
# On page B, insert the [Excerpt Include macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html] and point it to page A.

h3. Expected Results
The links should point to the original page, that contains the headers.

h3. Actual Results
If the headers are not part of the Excerpt with the included content, the links will not do anything when being tapped. If the excerpt has the headers included, the links will properly point to it.

h3. Workaround
Include the headers in the excerpt as well.
fields.summary: Table of Contents links points to the current page when inside Excerpt Include

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting a page on the new editor with the Roadmap Planner inside it to PDF, the Roadmap Planner macro is not showing up in the export.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page with the Roadmap Planner macro;
 # Export the page to PDF;
 # Notice that the file will be blank where the macro was supposed to be in.

h3. Expected Results

The Roadmap Planner macro should show up in the output PDF file
h3. Actual Results

The macro is not showing in the output PDF file
h3. Workaround
 * No workaround available at the moment
fields.summary: Roadmap planner export to PDF not working

fields.description: When making changes and moving pages in Confluence, the dialog box with the 'Undo' button pops up on the bottom left corner of the screen. It would be more user-friendly if the dialog pop up showed on the right side of the screen so not to block the Confluence menu.
fields.summary: Move 'Undo' dialog box from the left side to the right side of screen

fields.description: Please consider adding and whitelisting of [Remove User from Group|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-experimental-cql-pdcleaner-post] REST API. We would like to replicate our P2 app to Cloud to support the future migration of our clients from server to cloud.
fields.summary: Please provide a REST API to 'Remove User from the Group'.

fields.description: Please consider adding and whitelisting of [Add User to Group|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-experimental-cql-pdcleaner-post] REST API. We would like to replicate our P2 app to Cloud to support the future migration of our clients from server to cloud.
fields.summary: Please provide a REST API to 'Add User to the Group'.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the new editor, it's not possible to access the attached files using the "Files & Images" button. Accessing "recent uploads" is not the same as accessing files from existing attachments on the page as it uploads a new version of a file. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Click on the "Files & Images" button.
# Attach a file
# Edit the page and click on the "Files & Images" button to re-attach the file inserted in Step 3

h3. Expected Results
- It should be possible to access the attached files using the "Files & Images" button.

h3. Actual Results
- Accessing attached files using the "Files & Images" button will only give you an option to "recent uploads" which is not the same as accessing files from existing attachments on the page as it uploads a new version of a file. 

h3.  Note
Using the *!* to fetch a file from the attachments page in the old editor will create a reference to other pages. This feature is not possible using the "Files & Images" button in the new editor. 

h3. Workaround
There is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't access attached files on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Visio diagram files (vsdx) are not being displayed/previewed when you click on view on the attachments of the page, or when you click to view the file uploaded in the page, like a PDF does. 
The .vsd file preview works, but the .vsdx does not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a .vsdx file on a Confluence page directly in the page or through the attachments on the page
 # After uploading, click on the file to preview it or go to the attachments of the page and click on view

h3. Expected Results

Visio .vsdx files open the preview normally as the .vsd files.
h3. Actual Results
It does not open, only downloads the file.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Visio diagram files (vsdx) are not being previewed on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Include page within a Custom Template doesn't show the Preview or the page

Page excerpts work similarly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Custom Template
 * Add an Include Page Macro
 * Load the Preview

h3. Expected Results

Macro will render the Page Content
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
Unable to render {include} The included page could not be found
{code}
h3. Workaround

Publish the page to view the content
fields.summary: Include page macro not showing preview in Templates "Unable to render {include}"

fields.description:
I'd like to have an option for a generic timeline in the roadmap widget that isn't tied in to specific dates. so that we can show the client a basic approach to the project but are not commited to a specific time slot already.

!image-2019-11-27-11-37-17-286.png!
fields.summary: Roadmap widget's timeline without specific times

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the Link macro works either with Recently Viewed Pages or work by pasting the required page link. Screenshot attached.

h3. Proposed Solution

It would be very useful if the link macro search for pages within the space or within the confluence instance. For eg. If we type Ri as in word Risk in the link macro search, list all the pages that start with Ri
fields.summary: Link Macro Search for Pages

fields.description:
After creating space in onboarding/create space separately using blank/template, click edit button to go into editor mode.  All formatting options except text color were greyed out and fragments were not selectable.

When attempted to update status field and publish/publish without notifying, message popped up saying "There was an error processing the request."

Issue is reproducible in [http://ccep.atlassian.net|http://ccep.atlassian.net/] using site admin account or confluence user account. Chrome browser, normal and incognito mode, and IE11 were tested to reproduce the issue consistently.

Editor could work properly when updating template/blueprint under Confluence -> Settings -> Global Templates and Blueprints
fields.summary: Free Tier cannot add/edit pages using new editor

fields.description:
Hello,

Whenever an article is published, I don't want name of user who originally created it and the person who lastly updated it.
fields.summary: User Name must not Published

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes, after uninstalling an add-on, some requests will still expect contents by the add-on, such as /wiki/rest/dashboardmacros/1.0/updates.json and can possibly break the UI (in this case, /wiki/discover/all-updates)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

We were able to reproduce it with the [com.yasoon.calendar|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217554/outlook-calendars-for-confluence?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] add-on
h3. Expected Results

Confluence should not expect third-party / custom contents to be retrieved once the add-on is uninstalled
h3. Actual Results

Error shown on the UI:
{code:none}
Error details:
Error: Cannot read property 'map' of null.
Error info:
in Connect(AllUpdatesPage)
in Loadable(LazyAllUpdatesPageContainer)
in div
in div
in styled.div
in t
in div
in styled.div
in t

in WithAnalyticsEvents(t)
in t
in WithAnalyticsContext(WithAnalyticsEvents(t))
in RoutedTabs

in DiscoverTabs
in InjectIntl(DiscoverTabs)
in div
in oe
in DashboardTab
in DashboardPage

in Connect(InjectIntl(WithStyles(WithAnalytics(DashboardPage))))
in Loadable(LazyDashboardPage)
in div
in Styled(div)
in div
in Styled(div)
in n
in t
in div
in styled.div
in t
in Provider
in t
in div
in MainContentContainer
in GenericErrorBoundaryComponent
in GenericErrorBoundary
in ErrorBoundary
in GenericErrorBoundaryComponent
in GenericErrorBoundary
in ErrorBoundary
in t
in n
in g
in t
in div
in styled.div
in NavigationLoader
in NavigationExperienceWrapper
in p
in l
in withApollo(p)
in Unknown
in Loadable(NavigationIntegration)
in p
in l
in withApollo(p)
in ExperimentController
in ExperimentsController
in MainLayoutComponent
in y
in MainLayout
in withRoutesContext(MainLayout)
in T
in l
in withApollo(T)
in r
in t
in withRouter(r)
in t
in r
in Connect(r)
in p
in l
in withApollo(p)
in WrapForFeatureFlag
in R
in t
in ChangeboardingManagerComponent
in Connect(ChangeboardingManagerComponent)
in GenericErrorBoundaryComponent

in ErrorBoundary
in t
in ConfluenceAnalyticsListener
in t

in WithAnalyticsEvents(t)
in Unknown
in Unknown
in p
in l

in r

in y

in n

{code}
The request will fail with a 500 error:
{code:none}
/wiki/rest/dashboardmacros/1.0/updates.json?maxResults=40&tab=all&showProfilePic=true&labels=&spaces=&users=&types=&category=&spaceKey={code}
{code:none}
message: "Expected an enabled ContentTypeModuleDescriptor for key ac:com.yasoon.calendar:calendar, found none",
status-code: 500,
stack-trace: "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Expected an enabled ContentTypeModuleDescriptor for key ac:com.yasoon.calendar:calendar, found none at com.atlassian.confluence.content.DefaultContentTypeManager.lambda$getImplementingPluginVersion$1(DefaultContentTypeManager.java:61) at java.util.Optional.orElseThrow(Optional.java:290) at com.atlassian.confluence.content.DefaultContentTypeManager.getImplementingPluginVersion(DefaultContentTypeManager.java:61) at(...){code}
h3. Workaround

[Contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] and ask for a content reindex, mentioning this report's key - CONFCLOUD-68610

fields.description:
Hi, it seems impossible to insert files and images from other Confluence pages as the feature "Search on other pages" in the window "Insert files and images" is no longer available in the new editor. We use this quite often.

 

Is there any chance that this feature will be available again?

Kind regards,

Andreas
fields.summary: Insert files and images from other confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The user exported a page with Jira roadmap to PDF see a blank page for the Jira roadmap section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project on Jira and issue under the roadmap feature.
 # Add Jira roadmap to a confluence page
 # Export the page to pdf

h3. Expected Results

Jira roadmap being displayed on the PDF

h3. Actual Results

The user seeing a blank section instead of Jira roadmap data.

h3. Workaround

Take a screenshot of the Jira roadmap in Jira and display the image on the confluence page instead of adding Jira roadmap macro.
fields.summary: Jira Roadmap is not display in PDF

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating space or Page with characters j,g, or y results in bottom of letters being clipped off

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page or space using Firefox Using j, g or y
 # Publish page

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to view the entire letter
h3. Actual Results

Bottom of letters are clipped
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect line height on Overview page, and pages tree in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Inline comments made by anonymous users are not being displayed until you click the highlighted text and edit them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable anonymous access on the instance and create a publicly accessible space
 # Grant anonymous users *View* and *Add comment* permissions
 # Access the page as an anonymous user (private mode on the browser);
 # Highlight a part of the page's text and add an inline comment.

h3. Expected Results
 * Anonymous inline comments to be displayed whe you click the highlighted text.

h3. Actual Results
 * The comment is not visible when you click it > The only way to view it is to click the '*...*' **  sign on the upper corner of the comment > *Edit*
 * Anonymous inline comments show the current user as the owner of the comment (while viewing these comments in incognito mode "Anonymous" is correctly displayed);
 * Two GIFs below demonstrate this behavior:

----
*Viewing the page as anonymous*
 !anonymous view.gif!
----
*Viewing the page while logged in*
 !logged in view.gif!
----
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inline comments made by anonymous users are not being displayed

fields.description: It would be great to be able to have the "save for later" feature (or something similar) for documentation pages, and be able to build a list of top documentation pages for any look-up purposes later on.
fields.summary: "save for later" for confluence cloud documentation pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After the migration of the Page Comments section to the new editing experience, the Jira Issue macro is not available for comments anymore. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any page that you have 'Add Comments' permission; 
# Go to the comments section on the bottom of the page, start writing a comment, and then try to add the Jira Issue macro from the macro menu; 
# Notice that there will not be an option to add the Jira Issue macro to the comment anymore.

h3. Expected Results
The Jira Issue macro should be available to use, as it was in the old editing experience for comments. 

h3. Actual Results
The macro is not showing.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add Jira Issue macro to Page Comments in the new editing experience

fields.description:
It would be HUGELY efficient to have an *Open Jira Issue* command option on the menu for inline comments. Ideally, this would bring over the comment stream as well as the selected area of the problem page, and the menu would then have an option to open the associated issue.

!image-2019-11-22-14-18-17-665.png|width=827,height=208!
fields.summary: Convert inline comments to Jira tickets

fields.description: The ability to switch between multiple Confluence instances when using the iOS/Android app, without having to log in/out between each switch.
fields.summary: Connect to multiple Confluence instances from the mobile apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Quick search does return the result, but it says 0 result even though there is clearly a match
 !Screenshot 2019-11-22 at 15.27.19.png|thumbnail! 

Pressing enter/clicking Advanced search ends with 0 result. See attached video.

Search result is as expected when explicitly give individual permission (not via group) to the user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page with restriction. 
 # Give View+Edit permission to a group
 # Log in as a user that is a member of said group
 # Try to search for the page title using quick search & advanced search

h3. Expected Results

* Both should give same result: at least 1 match

h3. Actual Results

* Quick search returns the matched page, but say 0 result
* Advanced search just outright says no match found

h3. Workaround

Stick with quick search for now.
fields.summary: Search does not work correctly for restricted pages (group permission)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* In a code block macro, if we are adding a word with around 10k+ characters its just crash the Browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add a Code Block Macro
* Add code that contains a word with 10k+ characters.

h3. Expected Results
* Code will be added without any issue.

h3. Actual Results

 !Screen Shot 2019-11-22 at 13.45.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Split the word into less number of characters and paste to the code block section by section
fields.summary: Adding an element with large of character in Code Block Freezes the Browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, images inside a table don't have text wrap option. It also affects pages added to section macro in the old editor and was migrated to the new editor. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to add text wrap to an image added in a table
fields.summary: Ability to add text wrap to an image added in a table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After creating a new page (new fabric editor), the user not seeing the edit button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open confluence in firefox
 # Create a new page and publish it

h3. Expected Results

Once the page is created and published, the user will be able to see the edit button.

h3. Actual Results

The user not seeing the edit button right after creating and publishing the page.

h3. Workaround

# Refresh the page
#  Use another browser
fields.summary: Edit button missing in firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A template without a variable outside a table will block saving new variables inside the table in the template.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new template.
# Add a table 
# Create a new variable inside the 1st row of the table 
# Create a 2nd variable inside the 2nd row of the table

h3. Expected Results
- The page saves normally.

h3. Actual Results
- You will only be able to add one variable inside a table and adding a new variable to the table won't save when you publish the template. 

h3. Workaround
- Add a variable outside the table.
fields.summary: Unable to add more variables inside a table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The document [We're cleaning up the macro browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html] has reference to the workaround for  *"HTML comment macro not working anymore"*. The suggested workaround is to change the text color to white as a way to hide text on the page., *+however+* the workaround isn't viable for two reasons:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# The HTML macro shows the content of a page in edit mode giving an editor a view hidden content. Changing the text color to white font will not produce the same result as both a viewer and an editor will not be able to the visibility of the content in white font.
# The color white is currently unavailable in the new editor.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce reason 1
# Open a page using the old editor with the HTML comment macro present
# copy the content of the HTML comment macro
# Paste the copied content directly unto the page
# Highlight the copied content and change the text color to white.

h3. Expected Results
The content is hidden in view mode but visible in edit mode

h3. Actual Results
The content is hidden both in view and edit mode. We also have to keep in mind that the newer version of our editor does not even have the macro in the first place. Additionally there is no white font option at all in the new editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce reason 2
# Create a page using the new editor
# Type content you want to hide
# Highlight the content you want to hid
# Click the font color icon and try to apply white color to the content

h3. Expected Results
White color is in the color option

h3. Actual Results
No white color is available for selection.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there's no known workaround for this.
fields.summary: HTML comment macro workaround does not work

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The first letter of text looks different from what is supposed to be in the new editor if you installed a certain type of browser extension.

Here's a list of known extensions causing this bug:
 * [Loom|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/loom-video-recorder-scree/liecbddmkiiihnedobmlmillhodjkdmb] version 3.3.57

Strictly saying, this is not a bug of [the editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html]; however, we'd like to track the issue to gather information to see if this happens to a wide variety of browser extensions so that the product team can determine whether the fix is needed from Confluence-side.

Evidence video: [https://youtu.be/OzzWcm3sR7U]

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Install a extension [Loom|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/loom-video-recorder-scree/liecbddmkiiihnedobmlmillhodjkdmb] (verified with version 3.3.57) to Chrome
 # Enable Japanese IME on your OS
 # Open a page with the new editing experience
 # Type "sanpuru"
 # Check the text looks *ｓあんぷる* (unexpected)
 # Turn off the extension
 # Type "sanpuru" again
 # Check the text looks *さんぷる* (expected)

h3. Expected Results

The expected input should be look like {{さんぷる}}.
h3. Actual Results

The actual input looks like {{ｓあんぷる}} while no error in the browser console.

 !Screenshot 2019-11-22 14.47.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Disable the problematic browser extension. Besides, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Unexpected behavior of Japanese text input with certain browser extensions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the new editor, if we create a page using a template/ blueprint that has both variables and instructional texts (placeholder text), the instructional text won't be rendered on the screen to fill the variables
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page template with variables and placeholder texts on it
 # Select to create a page with this new template

h3. Expected Results

Placeholder texts should be rendered when filling the variables
h3. Actual Results

Placeholder texts are hidden when filling variables:
||This is the template||This is the screen to fill the variables||
|!image-2019-11-21-20-22-05-735.png|thumbnail!|!image-2019-11-21-20-22-16-158.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Workaround

Currently the available workaround is to first fill the variables and then proceed with the page creation, where the placeholder texts will be shown.
fields.summary: Placeholder texts are not being rendered while filling variables on templates with the new editor

fields.description: This ticket is used to track interest for collaboratively editing drafts in the Confluence mobile application. Currently, Confluence mobile does not support editors across desktop and mobile platforms to be collaborating on a draft at the same time. Consequences of the current state include drafts not being able to publish and resulting in errors, loss of work drafted on mobile, drafts on mobile not syncing with the draft version on web, not being able to see most recent changes from web, and getting changes overridden by team members drafting on web.
fields.summary: Mobile Drafts and Collaborative Editing for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
For a page, go to the version history.

On this history, it would be useful to have the ability to edit a comment after it has been saved.

It would be acceptable to restrict this action to the version creator, but not necessary.
fields.summary: Allow editing of Page Version Comments

fields.description:
On the new editing experience, while inserting a list with the *Action List* macro, the blank space between them could be smaller, in order to save some content space on a page when this page is bigger than the usual.

!image-2019-11-21-17-33-05-884.png|width=395,height=215!
fields.summary: Reduces the white space on a Action Item's list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we are up to create a new space, if you chose the wrong blueprint and back to chose the one you want, it won't let you create the space

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to the Space Directory
2. Click "Create Space"
3. Select any template and click "Next"
4. On the next screen, click the "Back" button
5. Select a different template
6. Click "Next"

h3. Expected Results
Next screen pops up and you can create the space

h3. Actual Results
The screen does not progress and you can not create the space

*Notes*
* It doesn't seem to be a backend issue since no errors can be seen in the browser's network tab

h3. Workaround
You must refresh the page to go ahead and create the space.
fields.summary: Hitting the Back button when trying to create a new space doesn't let you select a different space blueprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Request parameters on a connect iFrame request for dynamic content macros don't work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a connect add on with a macro (potentially one with bodied macro)
 # Load a page

h3. Expected Results

request parameters are inputted correctly
h3. Actual Results

Instead of correctly applying the parameters 
 
 /request/{[content.id|http://content.id/]}/\{content.version}/\{output.type}/{[macro.id|http://macro.id/]}
 
for content id, version and output type  and macro id *we get them as in descriptor (without actual values)*
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Request parameters on a connect iFrame request for dynamic content macros don't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you copy large content (text or table from a spreadsheet), the editor will error out, making it not possible to save/publish the changes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page (that uses the new editor)
 # Copy the content from either of the 2 files below and paste it in the 
* [^t8.shakespeare.txt] 
*  [^Financial Sample.xlsx] 
 # Editor will error out

h3. Expected Results

* Page can be saved and published

h3. Actual Results

* You get error pop-up, saying "(!) There was an error processing the request."

The below exception is thrown in the browser console:
 !Screenshot 2019-11-21 at 16.55.01.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Copy and paste the content in segments. This workaround does not work for large tables as each paste will result in a new table. There is no way to join the tables.
fields.summary: Copy pasting large content in new editor pages breaks the editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we are creating a page to report JIRA issues using different JIRA macros, if the number of JIRA links is more than around 100, we face some issues to edit, load and copy this page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Insert multiple JIRA issues in the page, with JIRA macros (using JIRA filters or custom JQLs);
# Make sure the number of JIRA issues is 100 or higher.

h3. Expected Results
All the JIRA links load fine and the page is editable, copiable and loads fine.

h3. Actual Results
We receive timeout errors or the error below:
{code}
Error code 429 - JIRA server returned an error: Too Many Requests
{code}


*Notes* 
* This happens on both editor but on the old one 80 JIRA links are enough to start to experience issues;
* If the JIRA macro is set to *Table* and it is set to show 200 results or more if you are including custom fields, the slowness is worst - sometimes the page not even loads.

h3. Workaround
Split the page into multiple ones, in order to have around 50~70 JIRA issues per page.
fields.summary: Page containing around 100 JIRA links or more doesn't behave properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using Jira Issues Macro, you need to choose the project for which you want to display issues.

However, users want the ability to automatically choose the Jira project based on the project linked to the space in Confluence.

This would help users to use the Jira Issues Macro in Confluence Global Page Templates.
fields.summary: Ability to automatically select project in Jira Issues Macro based on linked project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upon the first publish of a page, edit and star icons do not show up

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and publish it

h3. Expected Results
The edit, star, and watch icons load

h3. Actual Results
Only the watch icon is loaded
 !スクリーンショット 2019-11-21 11.13.06.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
Reload the page and all of them will be loaded as expected
 !スクリーンショット 2019-11-21 11.13.14.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Upon the first publish of a page, edit and star icons do not show up

fields.description:
When having Confluence and [Analytics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/view-insights-on-spaces-972349404.html], the user will be able to export the content (to Excel) from the *Users* and the *Pages* tabs, but, this option is not available for the *Overview* part probably because it would not be compatible with the Excel format (as it has graphics and user pictures, for example).

In order to have the export option available for the *Overview* part, this is a suggestion to:

# Provide additional export options (e.g. PDF, Word or TXT) for any of the parts.
# Have the export function available for the *Overview* page based on one of the formats listed above.
fields.summary: Additional export options for Analytics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using any of the editing experiences causes issues when we are trying to upload large files around 2GB size.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
If you are using a MacBook,  run the below code on your terminal to generate a dummy file with 2GB
{code}dd if=/dev/random of=file.txt count=2048 bs=1048576{code}

# Create a page;
# Click over the *Files&Images* icon in the toolbar;
# Attach the 2GB file.

h3. Expected Results
The file starts to be uploaded and we can track the upload status in the loading bar. After it is done, the file is attached to the page.

h3. Actual Results
*Old Editor*: the upload doesn't happen and an error message appears "_Error connecting to server._"
*New Editor*: the uploading bar doesn't appear, so we do not have a way to check how is the upload progress.

*Notes*
* For the old editor, the failure is most present using Firefox;
* It is also possible to see that after selecting the file to be updated, we receive a 404 error in the browser console - with the old editor.

h3. Workaround
*Old Editor*: after a few attempts to upload the file, we can get it done - using Google Chrome works better.

*New Editor*: just drag and drop the file directly to the page.
fields.summary: Issues uploading files around 2GB

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- A table row or content heading can straddle page breaks in PDF exports

h3. Suggested Solution
- It would be better if all parts of a single table row appeared on the same page and better page breaks for page content and heading.
fields.summary: Table row or Content Heading can straddle page breaks in PDF exports

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With smaller screen resolutions or smaller browser windows, the Date Macro is cut off and it's not possible to scroll up to see the top of the macro (if the macro is at the top of the page). 

!CleanShot 2019-11-20 at 11.39.22.png|width=275,height=200!

With the regular macro browser, it appears cut off, yet it's possible to scroll around within the window: 

!2019-11-20 11.40.48.gif|width=305,height=251!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in the New Editing Experience.
 # Insert the Date Macro (typing // as the shortcut)
 # Reduce the browser window size until the macro is cut off.

h3. Expected Results

Date macro should either appear like this, or provide the user the ability to scroll up to see the entire macro in order to select a date.

!CleanShot 2019-11-20 at 11.38.10.png|width=235,height=246!
h3. Actual Results

_See Issue Summary_
h3. Workaround

If the window is large enough, placing another date macro further down on the page will allow for selection.
fields.summary: Reduced/smaller screen resolution cuts off Date Macro

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 27 October 2021}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your patience as we work on fixing this bug. We’re currently making some larger architectural changes to PDF Export that should resolve this bug (and many other PDF export related issues) that is set to fully release in early 2022. We acknowledge that this has run into delays as the development team wants to ensure that we will not regress on functionality with the architectural improvements.

We know you have been waiting eagerly for this fix as we are, and we will be providing any updates as they come. Thank you again for your patience.

Best,

Steven
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Issue Summary

Exporting a space with 1000 + attachments hang the export at 50%
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Navigate to space with more than 1000 attachments
 * Perform a Full PDF export

h3. Expected Results
 * Export finished successfully

h3. Actual Results
 * Export stuck at 50 % with the message _Begin conversion of Intermediate HTML to PDF_

h3. Workaround

Perform a custom export with a minimal number of pages to reduce the number of attachments in the export file.

*Note*
 When trying the custom export, please export the Restricted pages separately, as these pages will not be added to the export
fields.summary: PDF space export stuck at 50 %

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

To calculate search success, the GASv2 editor event is used - "confluence.spa.editor.start". This does not appear to be firing on Hello. It might have something to do with an editor version.

Without this, the Search & Smarts team cannot reliably calculate and report search session success.

Please investigate and either restore the GASv2 event, or provide an alternative GASv3 event that is reliably fired on all editor opens.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Quick Search on hello.atlassian.net
 # Type "metric reporting"
 # Click on the first result, titled "metric reporting"
 # Open up the analytics chrome extension 
 # Click the "Edit" button

h3. Expected Results

You should see the confluence.spa.editor.start event fire in the GASv2 events.
h3. Actual Results

confluence.spa.editor.start should fire with the searchSessionId
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: confluence.spa.editor.start event not fired in all cases

fields.description:
h3. The Problem

It is not possible to create indented lists in the new editing environment. This feature is a must have!
h3. Why is it important

The indented checkbox lists have been an essential feature for us for years: we heavily use them in dozens of todo lists and backlogs. Removing indentation in checkbox lists will garble our current planning process and workflow and will block it in future. It is so important for us, that we will be forced to move away from Confluence and look for other tools for our planning.
h3. Suggested solution

Have a similar solution as what was found in the Legacy Editor / Server editor. 

 

 

!image-2019-11-20-10-48-41-186.png!
fields.summary: Indentation in checkbox lists

fields.description:
h2.Problem
It's not possible to create footnotes in Confluence.

h2.Suggestion
Define a citation at the bottom of the page with a reference tag like:
\ab01 - Title of the citation.

Then in the editor if would reference with some tag like \ref
{ab01}

Once the page is published, I would be create to see the reference in the text show up at [1] and the reference list at the bottom of the page like
[1] ....
[2].....
fields.summary: Ability to create footnotes in Confluence without using Macros

fields.description: Allow to configure a custom email address which can be used to send out Confluence notifications. Customers can then choose another email address different from {+}confluence@mail-us.atlassian.net{+}.
fields.summary: Allow custom email address for Confluence notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After uploading a file, Confluence users can immediately publish a page, whether or not the upload succeeded or completed. Later on, when accessing the page's attachment, the user will see an error "The file with the given id does not have any binary content".
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page in the new editor
 # Upload an attachment
 # Publish the page immediately even if the attachment failed to upload or didn't finish uploading

h3. Expected Results

 If the upload fails, the user should be notified that the upload needs to be re-completed. The publish button is grayed out to prevent the user from publishing the page until the upload finishes. Once the file is uploaded and the user publishes the page, the user is able to access the uploaded attachment.
h3. Actual Results

The user can publish the page with the attachment even if the attachment didn't finish uploading or has failed to upload. Later on, when accessing the page's attachment, the user will see an error "The file with the given id does not have any binary content". The error makes it appear that the file was lost when it never finished uploading.
h3. Workaround

Wait a few extra minutes to finish the upload before publishing the page. If the upload failed, re-upload the attachment.
fields.summary: Users can publish page without finalizing attachment upload

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, users are able to customize Confluence in some restricted areas, as described in [Changing the Look and Feel of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/changing-the-look-and-feel-of-confluence-724765494.html], but the only availabe icon customization is for the site icon itself.

h3. Desired Results
Users should have the ability to customize other icons, such some icons on the sidebar (e.g. activity, Spaces, etc.) similar to site logo customization option.
fields.summary: Allow users to upload custom icons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Info Macro on the new editor is being rendered with the old editor formatting when referenced on another page (also using the new editor) inside an *Include Macro*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page (A) using the new editor and insert an *(i) info* macro into the page
 # Create another page (B) also using the new editor and insert an *Include* macro into it;
 # On the *Include* macro select Page A
 # Either Publish the page or click Preview

h3. Expected Results
 * Info macro from page A to be rendered as the new info macro format

h3. Actual Results
 * Info macro from page A is rendered as the info macro from the old editor, as can be seen in the comparison below. (This result is displayed both on edit mode and published version of the page)

 

*Edit Mode*

!Screen Shot 2019-11-19 at 10.51.33.png!

 

*Published version*

!Screen Shot 2019-11-19 at 11.16.01.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Info Macro is being rendered with the old editor formatting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to create a template which has an additional step like *File List* from the Dialog window, and closed the dialog button without creating it, won't allow subsequent page creations in the same session

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Click on + button
 * Click on File List or Meeting notes, click Next 
 * Close the Dialog window
 * Try to create a page again
 
h3. Expected Results
* Page will be created with the required template

h3. Actual Results
* Dialog window freezes, the page cannot be created.

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page or do not close the Page Creation window in between the page creation.
fields.summary: Page Creation not working if the create page dialog is closed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When both Include page macro and Table of Contents macro is added to a template where the *page* added to the Include macro doesn't have content to render, the Table of contents macro will end up in error in the Publish mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a Custom template
* Add TOC, Include Page Macro
* Add a page which has corrupted content like Image not loading,  in the *Include Page* macro

h3. Expected Results
* The template will be published with both contents of the macro.

h3. Actual Results

{code}
Error rendering macro 'toc' : [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxParsingException: Duplicate attribute 'src'. at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,2070]
{code}
h3. Workaround

Make sure, the page within the Include Page macro has all the content pushed properly
fields.summary: Table of Contents not working with Include Page Macro

fields.description:
In Confluence --

# List boxes that can be placed and used inside and outside table
fields, ie virtually anywhere in the document, and where the selection can
not be made in edit mode.
# Radio boxes that can be placed and used inside and outside table
fields, ie virtually anywhere in the document, and where the selection can
not be made in edit mode.
# Check boxes that can be placed and used inside and outside table
fields, ie virtually anywhere in the document, and where the selection can
not be made in edit mode. And importantly, these check boxes should not be
confused with tasks that appear in a task list.
fields.summary: List Boxes, Radio Boxes, Check Boxes

fields.description:
The current options to set Space settings through the Atlassian Confluence Cloud API are rather limited (routeOverrideEnabled only).

It would be great to be able to set the settings in the API upon creating the Space or updating its settings so that linking a Confluence Space to a JIRA project can be automated.
fields.summary: Set Confluence (Cloud) Space settings through API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Word file content has a Heading with a numbering format, importing the Word file in Confluence will not import the Numbering Heading Format. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Word file that has a heading with a numbering format. 
# Save the Word file
# Import the Word file to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
- Numbering Format Heading in Word file should be imported in Confluence


h3. Actual Results
- Importing the Word file in Confluence will not import the Numbering Heading Format. 


h3. Workaround
- Manually type the numbers instead of using the Numbering Format.
fields.summary: Numbering Format Heading in Word file was not imported to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page blueprints created in the past, when the instance was still on the legacy editor, will break when this instance is migrated to the new editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a template with macros and variables on the legacy editor
 # Migrate the instance to the new editor.

h3. Expected Results

The template should still work on the new editor
h3. Actual Results

The template breaks, macros and variables won't load
h3. Workaround

Currently, the available workaround is to recreate the broken templates.
fields.summary: Page templates (blueprints) created on the legacy editor will break on the new one

fields.description:
On the old editor, the shortcuts *COMMAND + M * / *CTRL + M* were used to call the Files&Images option, in order to insert a file while editing a page. 

This shortcut was removed on the new editor and it would be nice to have it back, as it saves us time while creating content on our company - saving clicks always very welcome!
fields.summary: COMMAND + M / CTRL + M shortcuts to attach files

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After inserting an image in the editor and changing its side to a bigger one, once we change also its alignment to Right or Left, it won't keep the size we just set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert an image;
# Resize this image and let it bigger than the original size;
# Change its alignment to right or left.

h3. Expected Results
The image is changed successfully as it is.

h3. Actual Results
The image gets its size changed to a smaller one.

*Notes*:
* Sometimes, depending on the image's size, even not keeping the original size of the image, it gets changed after changing its alignment

h3. Workaround
Change the image alignment before to change its size.
fields.summary: Resizing an image and then change its alignment to Left or Right changes the size we set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when you try to use a Jira filter from a macro (e.g *Filter Results*, *Two-dimensional filter gadget* and *Created vs Resolved chart*) macro, the following message will be displayed on the browser, avoiding it to be used:

"Could not load unknown macro in the macro browser."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/edit a Confluence page
# Insert any macro that is used as a filter to retrieve the information from Jira *Filter results* (e.g *Filter Results*, *Two-dimensional filter gadget* and *Created vs Resolved chart*) macro by either using the "/" key (or "{" for the legacy editor) or the macro browser

h3. Expected Results
The macro configuration should open without issues.

h3. Actual Results
The "Could not load unknown macro in the macro browser." message is displayed and the user can't interact with it.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for the macro/gadget itself, but, you can use the [Jira issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] in order to display a filter/JQL.
fields.summary: Unable to use Jira gadgets/filters from macros in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create from template macro and content report table are not displaying on a mobile browser.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Create from template macro or content report table on a page
 # Open Confluence mobile browser


h3. Expected Results

The user is able to see the content of the macro.


h3. Actual Results

The user seeing the following
 !M.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Click on the message and it will bring the user to the desktop version of mobile.
fields.summary: Macro not displaying on Mobile browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After publishing a page the edit button is missing and needs to refresh the page to regain it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
- The Edit button should be visible after publishing the page. 

h3. Actual Results
- The Edit button is not visible after published and it's only visible after refreshing the page. 

h3. Workaround
- Manually refresh the page after publish
fields.summary: Edit button is missing after publishing a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Background color in table cell lost when importing a Word file to Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Word file with a table and cells with color.
# On a Confluence page go to *... -> Import from Word*
# Import the document

h3. Expected Results
- The background color in the table cell should remain after Word import. 

h3. Actual Results
Only the tables and text are saved in Confluence without the background color in the table cell. 
 
h3. Workaround
There is currently no workaround
fields.summary: Background colour in table cell lost when importing from Word

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The macro Excerpt Include is no longer displayed in the Fabric Editor. This makes editing very difficult. This also affects existing pages with the Excerpt Include macro. Open these in the editor and the macro will display with a blue thin line and it will be invisible when editing the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page or edit existing
 # Add an Excerpt macro to a page
 # Add an Excerpt Include macro to include the Excerpt on step 2
 # Publish the page
 # Edit the page

h3. Expected Results

Once you save the Excerpt Include macro you expect to see the excerpt displayed in the editor.
h3. Actual Results

The excerpt shows a thin blue line into existence and it is gone after a few seconds or editing the page. If the user Published the page, the excerpt is displayed correctly. But open the editor again and the macro is invisible and cannot be edited.
h3. Workaround

You can select the Excerpt Include macro by using the keyboard arrows to navigate through where the macro is, and the macro options will be displayed.
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-18 at 14.02.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Excerpt Include macro not working in Edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On a TinyMCE page, adding both [InVision|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217859/invision-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] macro and a Multimedia Macro will make the InVision macro's content to disappear

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Add an InVision Macro - [from this add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217859/invision-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
# Publish the page. 
# Notice that the macro displays correctly
# Edit the page
# Add a [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/multimedia-macro-724765227.html]
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
Both macros should display their contents

h3. Actual Results
Multimedia macro is displayed correctly.
InVision macro doesn't display

The below exception is thrown in the browser console:
{noformat}
prototype?v=21859de8f09be1bbe8a993e720e5e2232be05e31:1 [Simple-XDM] Cannot read property 'confluence' of undefined TypeError: Cannot read property 'confluence' of undefined
    at https://confluence.global.invisionapp.com/cloud/assets/static/js/main.676299bb.js:1:212828
    at b._handleResponse (https://connect-cdn.atl-paas.net/all.js:62:219)
    at b.a._receiveMessage (https://connect-cdn.atl-paas.net/all.js:20:502)
    at c (https://confluence.global.invisionapp.com/cloud/prototype?v=21859de8f09be1bbe8a993e720e5e2232be05e31:1:17119)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro and InVision Conflicting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Emojis in Table of Content Zone Macro changes to star

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page.
# Put Emoji in *Table of Content Zone* Macro.

h3. Expected Results
Emojis should remain as they are.
 !image-2019-11-15-20-54-52-609.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Emojis changes to star.
 !image-2019-11-15-20-54-23-074.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emojis in Table of Content Zone Macro changes to star

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. Description
This suggestion tracks interest for inserting images inline in the new Fabric editor.

h3. Workaround
# Go to *Emoji* in the toolbar
# Click *Add New Emoji*
# Set a emoji shortcut
# Upload the file you want to add in-line

h3. Notes
* Pages migrated from old editor to the new one, that contains inline images, might stop displaying those images. They'll show up as {{inlineExtension}} in published mode, instead.
* This behavior is also present when importing word documents as pages - Images that have text on the same line will be replaced by *inlineExtension* placeholders on the final page. (This can be replicated using the annexed .docx file)
*  [^this is an inline image.docx]
fields.summary: Allow Images to be inserted inline or in a sentence in the New Editor
